entries.content: Objections are opportunities for the prospect to request more information, not rejections.
Use presumptive questions to guide prospects to realize their problems without directly telling them.
entries.notes: Presumptive questions assume the prospect knows the answer, shifting their perspective.

entries.content: Ask: 'When you were offered the opportunity to automate this to save an hour every day, why did you say no?'
entries.notes: This question frames the objection as a missed opportunity, not a rejection.

entries.content: People buy emotionally; facts alone don’t sell. Use questions to connect facts to emotional pain.
Avoid direct confrontation by asking questions that lead prospects to self-realize inefficiencies.

focus_area: Objection Mindset: Objections = info requests, not rejections
